name: Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware

2025-09-15.content:
Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware 1.31.900-gke.38 is now available for [download](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/downloads). To upgrade, see [Upgrade a cluster](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/how-to/upgrading). Google Distributed Cloud 1.31.900-gke.38 runs on Kubernetes v1.31.12-gke.200.

If you are using a third-party storage vendor, check the [GDC Ready storage partners](https://cloud.google.com/anthos/docs/resources/partner-storage) document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release.

After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for use with [GKE On-Prem API clients](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/how-to/cluster-lifecycle-management-tools): the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.

Please check the GDC Ready storage partners document if you are using a third-party storage vendor. Note that it may take 7-14 days for the new version to be available with GKE On-Prem API clients.

summary.title: Google Distributed Cloud for VMware 1.33.0-gke.799 Available
summary.summary: The new version of Google Distributed Cloud for VMware (1.33.0-gke.799) is now available for download. This release runs on Kubernetes v1.33.2-gke.700. For upgrades, please refer to the provided documentation. It is recommended to check the GDC Ready storage partners list if you are using a third-party storage vendor. Please note that it may take 7-14 days for the new version to be available through Google Cloud console, gcloud CLI, and Terraform.

2025-09-02.content:
* GA: Changed the cluster creation process so that all new clusters are [advanced clusters](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/concepts/advanced-clusters). Additionally, all cluster upgrades to 1.33 are automatically converted to advanced clusters.
* Upgraded the `etcd` component to version 3.4.33.

summary.title: New advanced clusters
summary.summary: All new clusters are advanced clusters. Upgrades to 1.33 are automatically converted to advanced clusters. The etcd component has been upgraded to version 3.4.33.

2025-09-02.content:
* GA: Enabled the `vsphere-metrics-exporter` component for advanced clusters. This exporter provides greater visibility into the VMware vSphere environment by collecting key performance and health metrics.
* GA: Added support for VM-Host affinity groups in advanced clusters. This feature allows for the creation of rules that constrain cluster nodes to run on specific, predefined groups of hosts.
* GA: Added support for automatic node resizing in advanced clusters. This feature optimizes resource use by automatically adjusting the CPU and memory allocated to control plane nodes in response to workload demands.
* Public Preview: Added support for Virtual Machine (VM) tracking using vSphere
  tags in advanced clusters. This feature simplifies resource management by
  automatically applying identifying tags to cluster VMs.
* GA: Introduced an Envoy proxy sidecar to the GKE Identity Service for clusters
  that use Controlplane V2. This change enhances the security, reliability, and
  performance of the authentication service.

summary.title: New features for advanced clusters
summary.summary: Advanced clusters now support VM-Host affinity, automatic node resizing, and the vsphere-metrics-exporter for better VMware visibility. VM tracking with vSphere tags is in public preview. Envoy proxy enhances GKE Identity Service security.

2025-06-04.content: For clusters configured with [advanced clusters](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/distributed-cloud/vmware/docs/concepts/advanced-clusters), introduced an Envoy sidecar into the GKE Identity Service to increase security, reliability, and performance.

summary.title: GKE Identity Service Security Update
summary.summary: The GKE Identity Service for advanced clusters now includes an Envoy sidecar to enhance security, reliability, and performance.
